events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection yesterday evening around 7 PM.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle in the reported collision incident.
An agent was assigned to the case for handling the automotive insurance claim and to coordinate the necessary investigation process.
The customer received acknowledgment of the claim filing, confirming that the vehicle accident report has been entered into the system.
The insurance company requested additional documents including the police report, photos of the damaged car, and the driverâ€™s license copy.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including accident photos, repair estimates, and the official police report on time.
An investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted eyewitnesses to clarify the details of the auto accident.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the claimant was not at fault in the vehicle collision, supporting claim validity.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering all repair costs and rental car expenses incurred due to the accident.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the quick response and the proposed settlement amount for the auto accident claim.
The claim was officially approved after validation of all documents and acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
Payment was processed and issued to the claimant to cover the vehicle repairs as per the approved claim settlement.
The claim was officially closed following full payment and confirmation that vehicle repairs were completed successfully.
